Chapter 25, Part 10: The Ten Dedications, Part 10
Buddha's disciple!
What is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of the Dharma realm without measure?
Buddha's disciple!

This bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, with a pure silk headband tied to his head, abides in the position of Dharma master, extensively practicing the giving of the Dharma, giving rise to great compassion and establishing sentient beings, in the mind of enlightenment always practicing benefit without rest;
with the mind of enlightenment nurturing wholesome roots, for all sentient beings acting as a charioteer, showing all sentient beings the path of omniscience;
for all sentient beings acting as the sun of the Dharma treasury, the light of wholesome roots universally illuminating all;
in all sentient beings the mind is impartial, cultivating wholesome practices without rest;
The mind is pure and undefiled, with wisdom and mastery, not abandoning the path of all wholesome roots and karmic activities;
Acting as the great wise caravan leader for all sentient beings, universally enabling them to enter the peaceful and correct path;
Acting as the guide for all sentient beings, enabling them to cultivate all wholesome roots and practices of the Dharma;
Acting as the indestructible firm and solid good friend for all sentient beings, enabling their wholesome roots to increase and be accomplished.
Buddha's disciple!

This bodhisattva-mahÄsattva takes the giving of the Dharma as foremost, giving rise to all pure and wholesome dharmas, embracing and heading towards the mind of omniscience, with the power of the supreme vow ultimately firm and solid;

Accomplishing increase and benefit, endowed with great authority, relying on the good and wise, the mind without flattery or deception, contemplating and observing the boundless realm of the gateway to omniscience.
With these wholesome roots, he thus dedicates them in this way:
'May I be able to cultivate, accomplish, increase, and expand the boundless all-encompassing realm;
I vow to attain in the Buddha's true teachings, to listen to even a single verse or a single line, and to uphold and expound it;

I vow to be able to recollect the Buddhas of the Dharma realm, as numerous as the limitless and boundless worlds of the past, present, and future, and to cultivate bodhisattva practices after recollection.
Moreover, I vow to use this wholesome root of Buddha-remembrance to cultivate bodhisattva practices for a single sentient being in a single world for the duration of the future eons;
Just as in a single world, so it is in all worlds of the Dharma realm, the realm of space, and all worlds;
Just as for a single sentient being, so it is for all sentient beings.

With skillful means, I vow to be for each and every one of them, for the duration of the future eons, adorned with great vows, never to be apart from the thought of the Buddha as a good and wise advisor, always to see the Buddhas present before me, and not to miss the opportunity to draw near to any Buddha who appears in the world.
The pure practices praised and taught by all Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, I vow to cultivate and perfect them all, namely:

Unspoiled pure conduct, unbroken pure conduct, unadulterated pure conduct, unblemished pure conduct, flawless pure conduct, unobscured pure conduct, pure conduct praised by the Buddha, unattached pure conduct, unobtainable pure conduct, pure conduct that benefits Bodhisattvas, pure conduct practiced by the Buddhas of the three times, unobstructed pure conduct, unattached pure conduct, non-contentious pure conduct, unperishing pure conduct, abiding pure conduct, incomparable pure conduct, unmoving pure conduct, undisturbed pure conduct, unangered pure conduct.
Buddha's disciple!
If Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are able to cultivate such pure conduct for themselves, they will be able to universally do so for all sentient beings, enabling all sentient beings to abide in peace;
enabling all sentient beings to gain understanding;
May all sentient beings attain accomplishment;ğŸ”½May all sentient beings attain purity;
May all sentient beings attain freedom from defilements;
May all sentient beings attain illumination;ğŸ”½May all sentient beings be free from all defilements;ğŸ”½May all sentient beings be free from all obscurations;
May all sentient beings be free from all afflictions;
May all sentient beings be free from all bonds;
May all sentient beings forever leave behind all evil;
May all sentient beings be free from all harm and ultimately be pure.

Why is it so?ğŸ”½Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas themselves cannot purify their own pure conduct, nor can they cause others to attain purity;ğŸ”½They themselves have backsliding in their pure conduct, yet they cannot cause others to be without backsliding;
They themselves have degeneration in their pure conduct, yet they cannot cause others to be without degeneration;
oneself being far removed from pure conduct, unable to cause others to always not be far removed;
oneself being lazy in pure conduct, unable to cause others not to give rise to laziness;
oneself not giving rise to faith and understanding in pure conduct, unable to cause others' minds to give rise to faith and understanding;
oneself not abiding in pure conduct, unable to cause others to attain abiding;
oneself not penetrating pure conduct, unable to cause others' minds to attain penetration;
oneself abandoning pure conduct, unable to cause others to always not abandon;
oneself being distracted in pure conduct, unable to cause others' minds not to be distracted.
Why is this?

Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas abide in unerring practice, expound the unerring Dharma, their words are true, they practice in accordance with their words, purify body, speech, and mind, free from all defilements, abide in unobstructed practice, and extinguish all obstructions.
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas themselves attain a pure mind and expound the Dharma of a pure mind for others;

They themselves cultivate harmony and forbearance, and with all wholesome roots they tame their minds, causing others to be harmonious and forbearant, and with all wholesome roots they tame their minds;
They themselves are free from doubt and remorse, and also cause others to be forever free from doubt and remorse;
They themselves attain pure faith, and also cause others to attain indestructible pure faith;
They themselves abide in the true Dharma, and also cause sentient beings to abide in the true Dharma.'
Buddha's disciple!

Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas further dedicate the wholesome roots born from the giving of the Dharma in the following way: 'May I attain all the buddhas' inexhaustible Dharma doors and extensively explain them for sentient beings, causing them all to rejoice, their minds filled with satisfaction, and may I crush all the heterodox theories of non-Buddhists.

I vow to be able to expound for all sentient beings the Dharma ocean of the buddhas of the three times, to attain the boundless and inexhaustible treasury of dharmas in each and every dharma arising, each and every dharma's meaning and principle, each and every dharma's name and expression, each and every dharma's establishment, each and every dharma's explanation, each and every dharma's revelation, each and every dharma's gateway, each and every dharma's entry into realization, each and every dharma's observation, and each and every dharma's state, to attain fearlessness, to possess the four forms of unhindered eloquence, and to extensively distinguish and explain for sentient beings, continuing on into the future without end.
In order to enable all sentient beings to establish superior aspirations and give rise to unobstructed and unerring eloquence;

in order to enable all sentient beings to give rise to joy, in order to enable all sentient beings to accomplish the pure light of all dharmas, to expound without interruption in accordance with their various kinds of sounds:
In order to cause all sentient beings to deeply believe and rejoice, abide in omniscience, discern all dharmas, and be free from confusion, they think like this:

I should diligently cultivate for all sentient beings in all worlds, attain a body with immeasurable mastery throughout the Dharma realm, attain an immeasurable and vast mind pervading the Dharma realm, possess a pure voice equal to the Dharma realm, manifest a Dharma realm equal to the immeasurable assemblies and sites, cultivate immeasurable bodhisattva activities equal to the Dharma realm, attain immeasurable bodhisattva abodes equal to the Dharma realm, realize immeasurable bodhisattva equanimity equal to the Dharma realm, study immeasurable bodhisattva dharmas equal to the Dharma realm, abide in immeasurable bodhisattva practices equal to the Dharma realm, and enter immeasurable bodhisattva dedications equal to the Dharma realm.
This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of all wholesome roots, in order to cause sentient beings to all attain accomplishment in omniscience.
Buddha's disciple!
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas further dedicate their roots of goodness in this way:

Moreover, by means of these roots of goodness, may I attain the equality of blessings and virtues, the equality of wisdom, the equality of powers, the equality of fearlessness, the equality of purity, the equality of self-mastery, the equality of right enlightenment, the equality of expounding the Dharma, the equality of meaning, the equality of determination, and the equality of all spiritual powers. May these dharmas all be perfectly fulfilled.'
Just as I have attained, may all sentient beings also attain in the same way, no different from me.'

Buddha's disciple!
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattva further dedicates all wholesome roots in the following way:

'Not dedicating through grasping at karma, not dedicating through grasping at retribution, not dedicating through grasping at the mind, not dedicating through grasping at phenomena, not dedicating through grasping at events, not dedicating through grasping at causes, not dedicating through grasping at language and sounds, not dedicating through grasping at names, phrases, and syllables, not dedicating through grasping at dedication, not dedicating through grasping at benefiting sentient beings.'

with definitive wisdom, to make dedications;
with the skillful means of thoroughly understanding all buddha-dharmas, to make dedications;
